value.name: Blanket 20mph speed limits working, says Welsh government
value.description: Drivers travelled on average 4mph slower on main roads since the rollout of a new lower speed limit for built-up areas last year, figures show.

value.name: Voters are tougher on immigration than all of the main political parties and back policies often seen as the preserve of the Right, poll finds
value.description: A survey of more than 13,000 adults found that almost two-thirds want more restrictions on immigration, including slim majorities of Labour and Liberal Democrat voters.

value.name: Only Mordaunt could beat Starmer at next election, say Tory voters
value.description: Leader of the Commons only candidate backed by 2019 Conservative voters to give party a better chance if she replaced Rishi Sunak

value.name: Farmer Rish! woos the NFU conference in full-on panic to secure rural vote
value.description: Downing Street team was in love-bombing mode at farmers’ union meeting in Birmingham

value.name: I have your back, Rishi Sunak tells farmers at NFU conference
value.description: Sunak becomes first PM to address conference since Gordon Brown in 2008, as part of courting of farming sector

mentions.name: National Farmers Union of England and Wales

value.name: Supreme Court REJECTS appeal from Marjorie Taylor Greene claiming her rights were violated when she was fined $500 for refusing to wear a mask in Congress
value.description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday swatted away an appeal from three House conservatives over fines they were slapped with for refusing to wear a mask during the Covid pandemic. Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene, Ga., Thomas Massie, Ky., and Ralph Norman ...

value.name: Senior Tories question Badenoch’s decision to launch attack on ex-Post Office chair
value.description: Senior Tories have questioned Kemi Badenoch ’s decision to launch a stinging attack against the former Post Office chairman after he claimed he was told to delay payments to wrongfully accused postmasters.

value.name: Campaigners warn not to believe Labour triple lock pledge until it's in black and white
value.description: The Tories have said pensioners will take Labour's latest policy with a big pinch of salt, given previous U-turns.

value.name: How David Cameron can punish Russia for Alexei Navalny’s death
value.description: The Foreign Secretary has faced calls from senior Conservatives to use Magnitsky sanctions that target those involved in human rights violations or corruption

value.name: Trump boosters, Biden attacks – and a Liz Truss speech: What to expect at Republicans’ CPAC event this week
value.description: Donald Trump will take centre stage, as will his veepstakes, plus plenty of international characters. Eric Garcia reports ahead of the annual conservative gathering

video.name: Pelosi urges 'grotesque' Trump to have intervention

value.name: Blackpool South MP Scott Benton loses appeal after being caught in lobbying sting
value.description: Scott Benton will be given the 35 day recommended suspension after an independent panel dismissed his appeal. Benton was caught by the Times in April 2023, offering to lobby ministers and table parliamentary questions on behalf of gambling investors. Footage also showed him allegedly boasting there were ways to keep corporate hospitality secret.

value.name: Rishi Sunak should resist a swerve to the right
value.description: Bleeding support on that scale on its right flank, they say, could compound its losses in an election. They are urging Sunak to tack further to the right in cutting taxes, slowing climate goals and hardening his line on “illegal” migration,

value.name: Jackson Carlaw urged to cancel ADS Group 'arms dealer' event
value.description: READ MORE: Labour call for immediate ceasefire in major climbdown on Gaza The Scottish Greens have demanded Carlaw, formerly the leader of the Scottish Conservatives, cancel the event, due to go ahead on Wednesday. Ross Greer (above), the party’s ...

value.name: 'Total Tory Chaos': James Cleverly Sacks Immigration Watchdog After Security Clash
value.description: David Neal, the independent chief inspector of borders and immigration, was told he had “lost the confidence” of home secretary James Cleverly. He had previously accused the Home Office of failing to publish 15 critical reports he had carried out.

value.name: Bridget Phillipson hits out at Tories school phone ban
value.description: A North East MP has stated the government is "scraping the bottom of the policy barrel" following news that they are to fully ban mobile phones in schools. Education Secretary Gillian Keegan announced the news yesterday (February 19), following a pledge ...

value.name: This small, conservative law firm is landing big wins at the Supreme Court
value.description: In June, the Supreme Court’s conservatives voted together against its liberals to embrace that argument. Blum told CNN that the Consovoy firm has “an oversized influence on our nation’s jurisprudence.” In coming weeks, the firm’s lawyers are ...

value.name: Tories eye up May election to 'stop the bleeding' and head off mutiny against Rishi Sunak
value.description: A mega poll published by the Mirror this week suggested the Conservatives face an electoral wipeout - losing three quarters of their seats. The bombshell survey of 18,000 people predicted Mr Sunak will be left with just 80 MPs, which would be the party's ...

value.name: SNP heaps pressure on Labour by calling for commitment to £28bn green spending
value.description: The SNP at Westminster accused the Tories and Labour of blocking ‘Scotland’s entry to the green renewables goldrush’.

value.name: London Playbook PM: Labour fights its ceasefire war
value.description: UKRAINE ROW LATEST: Home Office Minister Tom Pursglove told the Commons it was “deliberate scaremongering” to suggest the government had reduced access for Ukrainians hoping to flee war to the U.K. Downing Street also insisted changes this week to application routes for Ukrainian refugees do not reduce eligibility.

value.name: Reaction from Blackpool South MP Scott Benton after he loses his appeal and faces a possible by-election
value.description: Blackpool South MP Scott Benton, who is facing a recall vote, says he is 'deeply disappointed' by the decision of an independent panel to dismiss his appeal against his 35-day suspension.

value.name: Inspections on water companies to quadruple ‘to end routine lawbreaking’
value.description: Inspections on water companies will quadruple over the next year in a bid to crack down on pollution by firms, the Government has announced. The measures to increase checks include up to 500 additional Environment Agency staff for inspections, enforcements and stronger regulation over the next three years.
